meanings.definition: The time of day when the sun is highest in the sky; midday.
meanings.sent1: At noontide, the sun shines directly above us.
meanings.sent2: Let's have a picnic at noontide when the sun is at its peak.
meanings.sent3: The cat always naps at noontide, claiming the warmest spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: The noontide of our journey was marked by a breathtaking view from the mountaintop.
meanings.sent5: The brightness of noontide made everything seem clearer and more vibrant.

meanings.definition: The highest point or culmination of something.
meanings.sent1: The success of the project reached its noontide when the investors agreed to fund it.
meanings.sent2: The artist's career was at its noontide with multiple exhibitions and awards.
meanings.sent3: The noontide of the party was when the surprise guest arrived with a cake.
meanings.sent4: As the noontide of the battle approached, both sides prepared for the final clash.
meanings.sent5: The noontide of her happiness was when she received the scholarship she had dreamed of.
